intro: Jacobaea nemorensis, commonly known as the mouse-ear hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that grows up to 30 centimeters tall, characterized by its basal rosette of silver-gray, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands, meadows, and disturbed areas. Jacobaea nemorensis is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
